leaspy.models.utils.initialization.model_initialization module¶

leaspy.models.utils.initialization.model_initialization.compute_patient_slopes_distribution(data)¶

Linear Regression on each feature to get slopes

Parameters

data – leaspy.io.data.dataset class object

Returns

slopes_mu : list of floats, slopes_sigma : list of floats

leaspy.models.utils.initialization.model_initialization.compute_patient_time_distribution(data)¶

Returns mu / sigma of given dataset times.

Parameters
data: a leaspy.io.data.dataset.Dataset class object

Contains the individual scores

Returns
  • mean: torch.Tensor
  • sigma: torch.Tensor
leaspy.models.utils.initialization.model_initialization.compute_patient_values_distribution(data)¶

Returns means and standard deviations for the features of the given dataset values.

Parameters
data: a leaspy.io.data.dataset.Dataset class object

Contains the scores of all the subjects.

Returns
  • means: torch.Tensor

    One mean per feature.

  • std: torch.Tensor

    One standard deviation per feature.

leaspy.models.utils.initialization.model_initialization.initialize_linear(model, dataset, method)¶

Initialize the linear model’s group parameters.

Parameters
model: a leaspy model class object

The model to initialize.

dataset: a leaspy.io.data.dataset.Dataset class object

Contains the individual scores.

Returns
parameters: dict [str, torch.Tensor]

Contains the initialized model’s group parameters. The parameters’ keys are ‘g’, ‘v0’, ‘betas’, ‘tau_mean’, ‘tau_std’, ‘xi_mean’, ‘xi_std’, ‘sources_mean’, ‘sources_std’ and ‘noise_std’.

leaspy.models.utils.initialization.model_initialization.initialize_logistic(model, dataset, method)¶

Initialize the logistic model’s group parameters.

Parameters
model: a leaspy model class object

The model to initialize.

dataset: a leaspy.io.data.dataset.Dataset class object

Contains the individual scores.

method: `str`

Must be one of: - “default”: initialize at mean. - “random”: initialize with a gaussian realization with same mean and variance.

Returns
parameters: dict [str, torch.Tensor]

Contains the initialized model’s group parameters. The parameters’ keys are ‘g’, ‘v0’, ‘betas’, ‘tau_mean’, ‘tau_std’, ‘xi_mean’, ‘xi_std’, ‘sources_mean’, ‘sources_std’ and ‘noise_std’.

leaspy.models.utils.initialization.model_initialization.initialize_logistic_parallel(model, dataset, method)¶

Initialize the logistic parallel model’s group parameters.

Parameters
model: a leaspy model class object

The model to initialize.

dataset: a leaspy.io.data.dataset.Dataset class object

Contains the individual scores.

method: `str`

Must be one of: - “default”: initialize at mean. - “random”: initialize with a gaussian realization with same mean and variance.

Returns
parameters: dict [str, torch.Tensor]

Contains the initialized model’s group parameters. The parameters’ keys are ‘g’, ‘tau_mean’, ‘tau_std’, ‘xi_mean’, ‘xi_std’, ‘sources_mean’, ‘sources_std’, ‘noise_std’, ‘delta’ and ‘beta’.

leaspy.models.utils.initialization.model_initialization.initialize_parameters(model, dataset, method='default')¶

Initialize the model’s group parameters given its name & the scores of all subjects.

Parameters
model: a leaspy model class object

The model to initialize.

dataset: a leaspy.io.data.dataset.Dataset class object

Contains the individual scores.

method: `str`

Must be one of: - “default”: initialize at mean. - “random”: initialize with a gaussian realization with same mean and variance.

Returns
parameters: dict [str, torch.Tensor]

Contains the initialized model’s group parameters.

leaspy.models.utils.initialization.model_initialization.initialize_univariate(dataset, method)¶
